class.name: Tree
class.brief_description: Control to show a tree of items.

method.name: are_column_titles_visible
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the column titles are being shown.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears the tree. This removes all items.

method.name: create_item
method.description: Creates an item in the tree and adds it as a child of [code]parent[/code]. If [code]parent[/code] is [code]null[/code], the root item will be the parent, or the new item will be the root itself if the tree is empty. The new item will be the [code]idx[/code]th child of parent, or it will be the last child if there are not enough siblings.

method.name: ensure_cursor_is_visible
method.description: Makes the currently focused cell visible. This will scroll the tree if necessary. In [constant SELECT_ROW] mode, this will not do horizontal scrolling, as all the cells in the selected row is focused logically. [b]Note:[/b] Despite the name of this method, the focus cursor itself is only visible in [constant SELECT_MULTI] mode.

method.name: get_column_at_position
method.description: Returns the column index at [code]position[/code], or -1 if no item is there.

method.name: get_column_title
method.description: Returns the column's title.

method.name: get_column_width
method.description: Returns the column's width in pixels.

method.name: get_custom_popup_rect
method.description: Returns the rectangle for custom popups. Helper to create custom cell controls that display a popup. See [method TreeItem.set_cell_mode].

method.name: get_drop_section_at_position
method.description: Returns the drop section at [code]position[/code], or -100 if no item is there. Values -1, 0, or 1 will be returned for the "above item", "on item", and "below item" drop sections, respectively. See [enum DropModeFlags] for a description of each drop section. To get the item which the returned drop section is relative to, use [method get_item_at_position].

method.name: get_edited
method.description:
Returns the currently edited item. Can be used with [signal item_edited] to get the item that was modified. [codeblock] func _ready(): $Tree.item_edited.connect(on_Tree_item_edited)
func on_Tree_item_edited(): print($Tree.get_edited()) # This item just got edited (e.g. checked). [/codeblock]

method.name: get_edited_column
method.description: Returns the column for the currently edited item.

method.name: get_item_area_rect
method.description: Returns the rectangle area for the specified item. If [code]column[/code] is specified, only get the position and size of that column, otherwise get the rectangle containing all columns.

method.name: get_item_at_position
method.description: Returns the tree item at the specified position (relative to the tree origin position).

method.name: get_next_selected
method.description: Returns the next selected item after the given one, or [code]null[/code] if the end is reached. If [code]from[/code] is [code]null[/code], this returns the first selected item.

method.name: get_pressed_button
method.description: Returns the last pressed button's index.

method.name: get_root
method.description: Returns the tree's root item, or [code]null[/code] if the tree is empty.

method.name: get_scroll
method.description: Returns the current scrolling position.

method.name: get_selected
method.description: Returns the currently focused item, or [code]null[/code] if no item is focused. In [constant SELECT_ROW] and [constant SELECT_SINGLE] modes, the focused item is same as the selected item. In [constant SELECT_MULTI] mode, the focused item is the item under the focus cursor, not necessarily selected. To get the currently selected item(s), use [method get_next_selected].

method.name: get_selected_column
method.description: Returns the currently focused column, or -1 if no column is focused. In [constant SELECT_SINGLE] mode, the focused column is the selected column. In [constant SELECT_ROW] mode, the focused column is always 0 if any item is selected. In [constant SELECT_MULTI] mode, the focused column is the column under the focus cursor, and there are not necessarily any column selected. To tell whether a column of an item is selected, use [method TreeItem.is_selected].

method.name: set_column_expand
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the column will have the "Expand" flag of [Control]. Columns that have the "Expand" flag will use their "min_width" in a similar fashion to [member Control.size_flags_stretch_ratio].

method.name: set_column_min_width
method.description: Sets the minimum width of a column. Columns that have the "Expand" flag will use their "min_width" in a similar fashion to [member Control.size_flags_stretch_ratio].

method.name: set_column_title
method.description: Sets the title of a column.

method.name: set_column_titles_visible
method.description: If [code]true[/code], column titles are visible.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], the currently selected cell may be selected again.
If [code]true[/code], a right mouse button click can select items.

The drop mode as an OR combination of flags. See [enum DropModeFlags] constants. Once dropping is done, reverts to [constant DROP_MODE_DISABLED]. Setting this during [method Control.can_drop_data] is recommended. This controls the drop sections, i.e. the decision and drawing of possible drop locations based on the mouse position.
If [code]true[/code], the folding arrow is hidden.
If [code]true[/code], the tree's root is hidden.
Allows single or multiple selection. See the [enum SelectMode] constants.

signal.name: button_pressed
signal.description: Emitted when a button on the tree was pressed (see [method TreeItem.add_button]).

signal.name: cell_selected
signal.description: Emitted when a cell is selected.

signal.name: column_title_pressed
signal.description: Emitted when a column's title is pressed.

signal.name: custom_popup_edited
signal.description: Emitted when a cell with the [constant TreeItem.CELL_MODE_CUSTOM] is clicked to be edited.

signal.name: empty_rmb
signal.description: Emitted when the right mouse button is pressed in the empty space of the tree.

signal.name: empty_tree_rmb_selected
signal.description: Emitted when the right mouse button is pressed if right mouse button selection is active and the tree is empty.

signal.name: item_activated
signal.description: Emitted when an item's label is double-clicked.

signal.name: item_collapsed
signal.description: Emitted when an item is collapsed by a click on the folding arrow.

signal.name: item_custom_button_pressed
signal.description: Emitted when a custom button is pressed (i.e. in a [constant TreeItem.CELL_MODE_CUSTOM] mode cell).

signal.name: item_double_clicked
signal.description: Emitted when an item's icon is double-clicked.

signal.name: item_edited
signal.description: Emitted when an item is edited.

signal.name: item_rmb_edited
signal.description: Emitted when an item is edited using the right mouse button.

signal.name: item_rmb_selected
signal.description: Emitted when an item is selected with the right mouse button.

signal.name: item_selected
signal.description: Emitted when an item is selected.

signal.name: multi_selected
signal.description: Emitted instead of [code]item_selected[/code] if [code]select_mode[/code] is [constant SELECT_MULTI].

signal.name: nothing_selected
signal.description: Emitted when a left mouse button click does not select any item.

constants.constant: Allows selection of a single cell at a time. From the perspective of items, only a single item is allowed to be selected. And there is only one column selected in the selected item. The focus cursor is always hidden in this mode, but it is positioned at the current selection, making the currently selected item the currently focused item.

Allows selection of a single row at a time. From the perspective of items, only a single items is allowed to be selected. And all the columns are selected in the selected item. The focus cursor is always hidden in this mode, but it is positioned at the first column of the current selection, making the currently selected item the currently focused item.

Allows selection of multiple cells at the same time. From the perspective of items, multiple items are allowed to be selected. And there can be multiple columns selected in each selected item. The focus cursor is visible in this mode, the item or column under the cursor is not necessarily selected.

Disables all drop sections, but still allows to detect the "on item" drop section by [method get_drop_section_at_position]. [b]Note:[/b] This is the default flag, it has no effect when combined with other flags.
Enables the "on item" drop section. This drop section covers the entire item. When combined with [constant DROP_MODE_INBETWEEN], this drop section halves the height and stays centered vertically.

Enables "above item" and "below item" drop sections. The "above item" drop section covers the top half of the item, and the "below item" drop section covers the bottom half. When combined with [constant DROP_MODE_ON_ITEM], these drop sections halves the height and stays on top / bottom accordingly.
